result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy Lynn Kerbel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: The Stayed jail sentence is concurrent with 2017CM156.

The Defendant has until 4:00pm on Friday 12-14-18 to report to Probation.
Cases 2015CM160 and 16TR196 & 197 are dismissed but read in for sentencing,

miscConds.notes:
The Defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge, the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice.
The Court orders $25/month to the Department.

No abusive contact with Frederico Delahuerta.
No operation of a motor vehicle with/out a valid license.
The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Lynn Kerbel

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on November 15, 2019 at 03:45 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 03:39 PM Defendant, Amy Lynn Kerbel, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State. 5 cases called. Atty Schmidt recites the agreement plead to 2 counts of bail jump 16CM 48 - no abusive contact, AODA, Plq form filed. The Court examines Def. it is her signature on the 2nd page. She understands the form completely, understands the charges she is pleading to, no drugs or alcohol w/in the last 24 hours. She understands the constitutional rights she is waiving today. She believes the State has enough evidence to prove her guilt beyond a reasonable doubt. She admits to bond violations, in 17CM156 she didn't come to court, in 16CM48 she violated her bond by driving w/out a license. She understands the citizenship laws. She understands that the Court is not bound by the agreement of the parties. she understands DRI charges. In the 2 cases she admits the facts are accurate. In Count 3 of 16CM48 and Count 1 of 17CM156 the Def. enters guilty pleas. The Court finds FB for pleas and JOC to be entered today. All other charges are DRI. The State enters argument for acceptance of these pleas. Atty Schmidt also enters argument for the acceptance of these pleas. Defendant declines aloq. The Court orders 1 yr prob. No op. No abusive contact,    No operation of a motor vehicle with/out a valid license,  AODA, 6 mo as imposed/stayed sentence concurrent. $443/per count. $25/month Friday @ 4 to report to probation.
Defendant, Amy Lynn Kerbel, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State. 5 cases called. Atty Schmidt updates the Court, requests plea hearing.
